title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\Scheduling
name: Scheduling
description:
Sets the scheduling options for an Instance. NextID: 21

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.Scheduling

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.automatic_restart
params.description: Specifies whether the instance should be automatically restarted if it is terminated by Compute Engine (not terminated by a user). You can only set the automatic restart option for standard instances. Preemptible instances cannot be automatically restarted. By default, this is set to true so an instance is automatically restarted if it is terminated by Compute Engine.

params.name: data.location_hint
params.description: An opaque location hint used to place the instance close to other resources. This field is for use by internal tools that use the public API.

params.name: data.min_node_cpus
params.description: The minimum number of virtual CPUs this instance will consume when running on a sole-tenant node.

params.name: data.node_affinities
params.description: A set of node affinity and anti-affinity configurations. Refer to Configuring node affinity for more information. Overrides reservationAffinity.

params.name: data.on_host_maintenance
params.description: Defines the maintenance behavior for this instance. For standard instances, the default behavior is MIGRATE. For preemptible instances, the default and only possible behavior is TERMINATE. For more information, see Setting Instance Scheduling Options. Check the OnHostMaintenance enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.preemptible
params.description: Defines whether the instance is preemptible. This can only be set during instance creation or while the instance is stopped and therefore, in a TERMINATED state. See Instance Life Cycle for more information on the possible instance states.

methods.name: getOnHostMaintenance
methods.description:
Defines the maintenance behavior for this instance. For standard instances, the default behavior is MIGRATE. For preemptible instances, the default and only possible behavior is TERMINATE. For more information, see Setting Instance Scheduling Options.

Check the OnHostMaintenance enum for the list of possible values.
